description.narrative: Action Against Hunger will deploy part of its programme team from Kalomba - where Action Against Hunger has a long established base - to Tshikapa to set up a sub-base and recruit local field officers. The logistics (transport, purchase, etc.) will be supervised from the Kalomba base. The same roster will provide a logistician/administrator from Kinshasa that will fly immediately to the zone. He will be in charge of ensuring compliance with all Action Against Hunger procedures. Local markets (Tshikapa and Kananga) have very limited stocks of often mediocre quality, so the NFI kits will be purchased in Kinshasa through known providers in order to ensure availability and quality. Action Against Hunger will use its simple emergency procedures in order to purchase the items within one week. They will then be transported by truck to Tshikapa within a maximum of 20 days. In the meantime, the field teams will conduct surveys to target and identify vulnerable households who will benefit from the kits, ensuring a community approach and ownership of the process. The distribution itself is estimated to last a maximum of 10 days and will reach 600 families (3120 beneficiaries).

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

description.narrative: Kasai-Occidental, Democratic Republic of the Congo (admin level 1)
